chapter.para: This document includes links to technologies being considered or used for OPTIMUS including brief summaries and analysis of how useful the technology may be for OPTIMUS, what strengths or weaknesses may make the technology particularly suitable or unsuitable for our use, etc.

sect1.title: summary
sect1.para: Python is a scripting language designed to be powerful, easy to use, portable, and easy to extend and integrate with other languages. It has advanced Object Oriented, procedural and functional programming features and a large and growing user community.

orderedlist.listitem: Using SWIG to interface scripting languages with C/C++ (a simple tutorial)

sect1.title: summary
sect1.para: SWIG (Simplified Wrapper and Interface Generator) is a software development tool that connects programs written in C and C++ with a variety of high-level programming languages. SWIG is primarily used with common scripting languages such as Perl, Python, Tcl/Tk, Ruby, Guile and MzScheme, however the list of supported languages also includes non-scripting languages such as Java and OCAML. SWIG is most commonly used to create high-level interpreted programming environments, user interfaces, and as a tool for testing and prototyping C/C++ software.

sect1.para: The Python Imaging Library (PIL) adds image processing capabilities to your Python interpreter. This library supports many file formats, and provides powerful image processing and graphics capabilities.

sect1.title: summary
sect1.para: It is an open, object-oriented language designed to simplify the creation of new Web services. Water is extremely flexible and adheres to a "Learn Once, Use Everywhere" philosophy where data, logic, and presentation have a uniform representation. Water leverages your existing investment in processes, tools and platforms, and lets you incrementally adopt a Web service architecture. A thin-client development environment is freely available and services are easily deployed on a standard industry platform.

sect1.title: analysis
sect1.para: AP - my first impression is that Water is intended primarily as a web programming language and platform, similar in scope to PHP/ASP/JSP but (in theory) better architected. we'll have to look closer to really decide whether it holds its own as a general purpose programming language (especially in competition with python). also, it looks like currently, almost no one is using it, so there isn't much of a community to draw from, and very few 3rd party tools and packages (eg, like python has PMW, Numeric, PIL, pygame, etc).

sect1.title: summary
sect1.para: Pygame is a set of Python extension modules designed for writing games. The core of pygame is wrapped on top of the SDL library.

sect1.title: summary
sect1.para: The University of Chicago's Social Science Research Computing's RePast is a software framework for creating agent based simulations using the Java language (requires version Java 1.3 or greater). It provides a library of classes for creating, running, displaying and collecting data from an agent based simulation. In addition, RePast can take snapshots of running simulations, and create quicktime movies of simulations. RePast borrows much from the Swarm simulation toolkit and can properly be termed "Swarm-like." In addition, RePast includes such features as run-time model manipulation via gui widgets first found in the Ascape simulation toolkit.

sect1.title: summary
sect1.para: Ascape is a software framework for developing and analyzing agent-based models. In Ascape, agent objects exist within scapes; collections of agents such as arrays and lattices. These scapes are themselves agents, so that typical Ascape models are made up of "collections of collections" of agents. Scapes provide a context for agent interaction and sets of rules that govern agent behavior. Ascape manages graphical views and collection of statistics for scapes and provides mechanisms for controlling and altering parameters for scape models.

sect1.title: summary
sect1.para: R is `GNU S' - A language and environment for statistical computing and graphics. R is similar to the award-winning S system, which was developed at Bell Laboratories by John Chambers et al. It provides a wide variety of statistical and graphical techniques (linear and nonlinear modelling, statistical tests, time series analysis, classification, clustering, ...).

sect1.title: summary
sect1.para: OpenDX is a uniquely powerful, full-featured software package for the visualization of scientific, engineering and analytical data: Its open system design is built on a standard interface environments. And its sophisticated data model provides users with great flexibility in creating visualizations.

sect1.title: summary
sect1.para: GRASS GIS (Geographic Resources Analysis Support System) is an open source, free software Geographical Information System (GIS) with raster, topological vector, image processing, and graphics production functionality that operates on various platforms through a graphical user interface and shell in X-Windows. It is released under GNU General Public License (GPL).
